DataElement.preferredName: Acute Promyelocytic Leukemia Diagnosis Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded response that indicates a patient has a diagnosis of acute promyelocytic leukemia that meets the eligibility criteria for participation in a clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Acute Promyelocytic Leukemia with t(15;17)(q22;q12); PML-RARA Diagnosis
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An acute myeloid leukemia (AML) in which abnormal promyelocytes predominate.  It is characterized by the t(15;17)(q22;q12) translocation.  There are two variants: the typical and microgranular variant.  This AML is particularly sensitive to treatment with all trans-retinoic acid and has a favorable prognosis.  (WHO, 2001)_The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Acute Promyelocytic Leukemia with t(15;17)(q22;q12); PML-RARA
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An acute myeloid leukemia (AML) in which abnormal promyelocytes predominate.  It is characterized by the t(15;17)(q22;q12) translocation.  There are two variants: the typical and microgranular variant.  This AML is particularly sensitive to treatment with all trans-retinoic acid and has a favorable prognosis.  (WHO, 2001)

Concepts.longName: Acute Promyelocytic Leukemia with t(15;17)(q24.1;q21.2); PML-RARA
Concepts.definition: An acute myeloid leukemia (AML) in which abnormal promyelocytes predominate. It is characterized by the PML-RARA fusion. There are two variants: the typical and microgranular variant.  This AML is particularly sensitive to treatment with all trans-retinoic acid and has a favorable prognosis. (WHO)

Property.preferredDefinition: The process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms.

Concepts.definition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.
